ChIPbinner 0.0.0.9000

    • Analyzing binned ChIP-seq/Cut&Run data with ChIPbinner
  • Changelog

    Generate a scatterplot of bins annotated with genic and intergenic regions.

    genic_intergenic_scatterplot.Rd

    Using two normalized bigWig files generated using 'norm.bw', the user can generate a scatterplot to compare bins across two conditions (treated sample versus baseline sample (such as wildtype)). The bins will be annotated according to their overlap with genic and intergenic regions.

    genic_intergenic_scatterplot(
  out_dir,
  genome_assembly,
  cell_line,
  histone_mark,
  treated_samp_norm_bw,
  wildtype_samp_norm_bw,
  are_R_objects = FALSE,
  output_filename,
  title_of_plot,
  max_x,
  max_y,
  pow = NULL,
  xaxis_label,
  yaxis_label,
  min_x = NULL,
  min_y = NULL,
  show_scales = TRUE,
  show_legend = FALSE,
  legend_pos = NULL,
  height_of_plot = NULL,
  width_of_plot = NULL
)

    Arguments

    out_dir

    Output directory for the scatterplot.

    genome_assembly

    Must of be one of hg38 or mm10.

    cell_line

    The cell line of the samples.

    histone_mark

    The broad histone mark used for the analysis.

    treated_samp_norm_bw

    The normalized bigwig file for the treated sample.

    wildtype_samp_norm_bw

    The normalized bigwig file for the wildtype sample.

    are_R_objects

    Boolean term (true or false) to indicate if the inputted bigwig files are R objects. It'll use load() for the reps as opposed to reading them in via rtracklayer::import.bed(). Default to FALSE.

    output_filename

    Filename for the resuting scatterplot.

    title_of_plot

    The title of the plot.

    max_x

    The maximum value for the x-axis.

    max_y

    The maximum value for the y-axis.

    pow

    The power of. Returns the value of x to the power of y (x^y) and this is used for the scales (i.e. show bins if surpassing a certain intensity). Defaults to 1.25.

    xaxis_label

    Label for the x-axis. This is normally the baseline label (i.e. WT)

    yaxis_label

    Label for the y-axis. This is normally the treated sample label.

    min_x

    The minimum value for the x-axis.

    min_y

    The minimum value for the y-axis.

    show_scales

    Boolean term whether to show scales or not.

    show_legend

    Boolean term whether to show legend or not.

    legend_pos

    Legend position. The only two options are "left" or "right". Defaults to "left".

    height_of_plot

    The height of the scatterplot.

    width_of_plot

    The width of the scatterplot.

    Value

    Returns a scatterplot of bins annotated genic or intergenic comparing across two conditions.

    Details

    Title

    Examples

    library(data.table)
library(tidyverse)
library(matrixStats)
library(isoband)
library(sf)
library(ggrepel)
library(viridis)
library(MASS)
library(lwgeom)
library(hexbin)
library(pals)
library(patchwork)
library(GenomicRanges)
library(rtracklayer)
genic_intergenic_scatterplot(
  out_dir = system.file("extdata", package = "ChIPbinner"),
  genome_assembly = "hg38",
  cell_line = "Cal27",
  wildtype_samp_norm_bw = system.file("extdata/data","downsampled.Cal27.WT.H3K36me2.10kb.norm_bw.rda", package = "ChIPbinner"),
  treated_samp_norm_bw = system.file("extdata/data","downsampled.Cal27.NSD1_KO.H3K36me2.10kb.norm_bw.rda", package = "ChIPbinner"),
  are_R_objects = TRUE,
  histone_mark = "H3K36me2",
  output_filename = "downsampled_Cal27.WT_NSD1KO.H3K36me2.10kb",
  title_of_plot = "Cal27 ChIP-seq H3K36me2",
  xaxis_label = "WT",
  yaxis_label = "NSD1_KO",
  max_x = 1,
  max_y = 1,
  min_x = -5,
  min_y = -5,
  pow = 1.25,
  show_scales = FALSE,
  show_legend = TRUE,
  legend_pos = "left"
)
#> [1] "Generated genic/intergenic scatterplot!"
